timeline.bodyText: Should we update the method name too?
timeline.author: ijuma

timeline.bodyText: Isn't it better to keep UUID in javadoc when we're referring to the concept?
timeline.author: ijuma

timeline.message: Updated javadocs, changed a few more methods from (get,read,write)UUID to (get,read,write)Uuid

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a test that verifies that the hashCode is the same for our Uuid and Java's UUID? Or do we have that already?
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: We don't have that yet. I also didn't specify this behavior. Should I?
replies.author: jolshan

replies.bodyText: We don't have to specify it, but it would be good to ensure we have a test for the actual hashCode we're implementing. At the moment, we are only verifying that the hashCode is the same for two equal UUIDs and different for two unequal UUIDs. One option would be to have a few tests where we verify that the result is what we expect it to be.
replies.author: ijuma

timeline.message: Merge branch 'KAFKA-10618' of github.com:jolshan/kafka into KAFKA-10618
